title: Battling criminal sex charges, Sen. McAllister gets new ultimatum
text:
Battling criminal sex charges, Sen. McAllister gets new ultimatum Resign or face expulsion from Legislature, colleagues warn Published 7:32 PM EDT Oct 21, 2015 
Nearly six months have passed since state police arrested Franklin County Sen. Norm McAllister at the Vermont Statehouse on suspicion of sexual assault, a spectacle that stunned the Legislature and immediately led to calls for his resignation. Related Jim Webb to drop out of Dem... 
But the veteran lawmaker says he's not guilty of any crime and will be exonerated when he gets his day in court sometime next year. He's also refused to step down from the Senate. 
With lawmakers preparing to return to Montpelier in January, some are getting nervous about the circus that would ensue if McAllister returns to try to take his seat. The senator has already been stripped of his committee assignments. 
Caledonia Sen. Joe Benning has delivered an ultimatum to his Republican colleague -- either resign voluntarily or face an unprecedented resolution that will expel Mcallister from the Senate. 
Benning has given McAllister until Nov. 1 to do step down. 
McAllister did not respond to a message left Wednesday at his home. Tags McAllister Legislature Senator Sexual Assault Benning Baruth Statehouse
